content: The 90,000-square-foot ballroom will dwarf the main White House itself, at nearly double the size, and Trump says it will accommodate 999 people.

content: Weapons makers Lockheed Martin and RTX predicted strong profits for the rest of this year on Tuesday as their results benefited from surging demand for arms from conflicts in the Middle East and a protracted Russia-Ukraine war.

content: Minister inaugurates 67th Kerala School Sports Meet. Footballer I.M. Vijayan and Minister V. Sivankutty light ceremonial torch

title: BJP-JD(S) to form coordination panels separately for GBA area and rest of Karnataka
content: With elections to the Greater Bengaluru Authority on the horizon, the BJP-JD(S) coalition partners have decided to set up separate coordination committees for the GBA region and Karnataka for effectively tackling the government over various issues.

title: ‚ÄòTicket for kin‚Äô: despite protests, Bihar parties yield to dynastic pressure
content: Though top leaders like Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar are speaking up against dynasty politics and the danger it poses for democracy, the importance of family connections in electoral politics has not diminished in the latest Assembly polls

title: 'Spoke to PM Modi, he's not going to buy Russian oil': Trump repeats crude claim
content: President Donald Trump stated that Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi indicated India would significantly reduce its oil purchases from Russia. Trump shared this information following a conversation with Modi, emphasizing Modi's desire for the Russia-Ukraine war to conclude.

title: 2 days after Diwali, Delhi choked by thick smog; air quality remains 'very poor'
content: Delhi choked on thick smog two days after Diwali, with air pollution levels soaring to 'very poor'.  AQI reached 345, with some areas hitting 380.  Transport and industrial emissions are major contributors. Residents are reporting breathing issues and eye irritation, highlighting a persistent problem exacerbated by choices like firecrackers.

title: 'Political Islam' inflicted greatest blow on Sanatan Dharma': Yogi Adityanath
content: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath asserted that "political Islam" significantly impacted Sanatan Dharma, citing historical struggles by figures like Shivaji Maharaj and Maharana Pratap. He lauded the RSS's role in the Ram Temple's construction and announced a ban on Halal-certified products, alleging their profits funded conversions and terrorism. Adityanath outlined five RSS centenary initiatives for a developed India.

title: Adelaide ODI shock: Virat Kohli safe, but Rohit Sharma in big trouble
content: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma aim for a strong comeback in the second ODI against Australia at Adelaide after a disappointing return in Perth. Kohli boasts an impressive record at Adelaide Oval, while Rohit seeks to improve his modest statistics. Experts believe the duo will find their rhythm and contribute significantly to India's batting success.

title: Chandigarh horror: Man stabs mother 16 times on Diwali, slits throat
content: A 40-year-old man allegedly stabbed his 60-year-old mother 16 times at her Chandigarh residence on Diwali morning. The accused, reportedly mentally disturbed, fled the scene but was apprehended in Sonipat with the murder weapon. Police are investigating the incident further.

title: US 'technical rule' angers China, escalates trade tensions
content: The US expanded its export blacklist to include subsidiaries of listed companies, a move China views as a targeted escalation. This action, effective late September, has intensified the US-China trade war and influenced foreign governments, such as the Netherlands' seizure of chip firm Nexperia due to national security concerns.

title: Confirmed! Footage proves Pak's role in killing three Afghan cricketers - watch
content: Afghanistan Cricket Board claims to have video evidence of Pakistan's involvement in an attack that killed three local cricketers. Consequently, Afghanistan has withdrawn from the upcoming Tri-Nation T20I Series in Pakistan. The ICC and BCCI have expressed support for Afghanistan following the incident.

title: ‚ÄòFestival of lights‚Äô: PM Modi thanks Trump for Diwali greetings
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi  on Wednesday thanked US President Donald Trump for his Diwali greetings and phone call, highlighting India and the US as "great democracies" united against terrorism. Trump also extended Diwali wishes, mentioning discussions on trade and the situation with Pakistan, despite recent US tariffs on Indian oil imports.

title: Stock market holiday on Bali Pratipada: Will NSE, BSE remain closed for trading today?
content: Stock markets, including NSE and BSE, remained closed on October 22 for Balipratipada. This follows a positive Muhurat trading session yesterday, which marked the start of Samvat Year 2082. Regular trading operations are scheduled to resume on October 23.

title: MacKenzie Scott cuts Amazon stake by 42%; now holds $12.6bn; prioritises equity work
content: MacKenzie Scott has significantly reduced her Amazon stake, now holding shares worth $12.6 billion. This move comes as she continues her extensive philanthropic work, with recent substantial donations directed towards diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives, including significant gifts to organizations supporting low-income students and Historically Black Colleges and Universities.

title: Rock and rule: Japan PM Sanae Takaichi still drums heavy metal and loves Metallica
content: Japan's new Prime Minister, Sanae Takaichi, is a devoted heavy metal fan who plays drums to de-stress.  Despite her passion for music and promises of more women in cabinet, she appointed only two female ministers. Takaichi, a conservative politician, has held multiple cabinet roles and admires Margaret Thatcher.

title: Virat Kohli on notice! Mitchell Starc to repeat Perth tactics in Adelaide
content: Australian batter Matthew Short anticipates pacers will continue targeting Virat Kohli outside off stump after his duck in the first ODI. Kohli, returning to action after a break, faces a must-win scenario in Adelaide, his most successful overseas venue. Short also discussed his own role and preparation for the 2027 World Cup.

title: 'Blacklisted': UK-based researcher deported from IGI; officials cite visa norms violation
content: London-based academic Francesca Orsini was denied entry into India and deported after being blacklisted for violating her tourist visa conditions by conducting research. Officials stated that undertaking research requires a specific 'R' visa, and violating visa terms can lead to blacklisting, a sovereign right of any nation.

title: Economic warning: JPMorgan CEO urges action; Says US too dependent on unreliable sources
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon is launching a $1.5 trillion, decade-long plan to bolster America's industrial strength and reduce foreign supply chain reliance.  The Security and Resiliency Initiative will target defense, frontier tech, energy, and advanced manufacturing, with the bank committing $10 billion to kickstart these vital sectors. Dimon urges immediate, unified action to secure the nation's future.

title: American Airlines flight makes emergency landing after pilots mistake crew for hijackers
content: An American Airlines flight bound for Los Angeles made an emergency return to Omaha after pilots mistook cabin crew knocking on the cockpit door for a hijacking attempt. A glitch in the intercom system caused the miscommunication, leading to the safe landing and subsequent apology from the captain. The airport confirmed no security threat.

title: 'Virat, Rohit got found out': Australia's McGrath reacts to cricketers' ODI return
content: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's return to international cricket after an eight-month break saw them struggle on Perth's bouncy pitch, failing to make a significant impact against Australia. Both veterans were dismissed cheaply, raising questions about their form and future in the squad, especially with the 2027 World Cup on the horizon.

title: Conor McGregor & Dee Devlin Net Worth 2025: Inside their Irish empire of love & business
content: Conor McGregor, a renowned UFC fighter, has built a significant financial empire beyond his fighting career. His success is amplified by his partner, Dee Devlin, who manages his business operations. Together, this Irish power couple has transformed fame into a lasting business legacy, demonstrating the strength of teamwork and shared ambition.

title: Lamar Jackson injury update: Ravens QB misses practice
content: Lamar Jackson's hamstring injury continues to sideline the Baltimore Ravens quarterback, raising doubts about his availability for Sunday's crucial game against the Chicago Bears. Missing the past two games and Monday's practice, Jackson's return is vital for the 1-5 Ravens to salvage their disappointing 2025 season and playoff hopes.

title: Mitch Marner sparks Vegas shakeup: Confident comment after first goals
content: Mitch Marner's two-goal outburst against the Calgary Flames has revitalized the Vegas Golden Knights, propelling them to the top of the Pacific Division.  His return to form, coupled with a perfect power play performance, signals a strong start to his debut season in Vegas, promising exciting times ahead for the team and its fans.

title: 'He‚Äôs destroying your house': Hillary slams Trump over White House demolition for new ballroom
content: President Trump's plan for a $250 million private White House ballroom has drawn sharp criticism from Hillary Clinton, who decried the project as a misuse of public property. Demolition has begun on the East Wing, with the massive ballroom slated to accommodate nearly 1,000 guests, dwarfing the current East Room. Despite ongoing construction, formal approval from planning commissions is pending.

title: Bali Pratipada bank holiday: Are banks open or closed on Oct 22? Check list
content: Banks in several Indian states are closed on October 22 for Diwali and its associated observances. This festive week sees multiple bank holidays across different regions. While in-person banking services are unavailable, customers can still utilize online banking, ATMs, and mobile apps for essential transactions.

title: Bengaluru couple found hanging in rented house; no note left behind
content: A young couple from Odisha, Rakesh Kumar (23) and Seema Nayak (25), were found dead in their rented Bengaluru home. Neighbours alerted the owner after noticing no activity. Police suspect Rakesh died by suicide first, followed by Seema, possibly due to Rakesh's suspicions of an affair and alcohol addiction. Investigations are ongoing.

title: India-Afghan ties: After Muttaqi‚Äôs visit, New Delhi restores Kabul embassy
content: India has upgraded its technical mission in Kabul to an embassy, signaling a significant step in bilateral engagement following the Taliban foreign minister's visit. This move aims to expand economic cooperation and India's role in Afghanistan's development. The Taliban will also send diplomats to New Delhi, even as India maintains its stance on recognition and inclusive governance.

title: Govardhan Puja 2025: Images, wishes & greetings to share on social media
content: On the auspicious day of Govardhan Puja, share happy quotes, wishes, messages, and more with your loved ones and celebrate this Indian festivity, sharing happiness with each click.

title: Michael Jordan NBA on NBC: 2025‚Äì26 Schedule, lineup & where to watch
content: Basketball legend Michael Jordan returns to NBA on NBC this Tuesday. He will appear on a special halftime show titled 'MJ: Insights to Excellence'. Jordan will share his basketball experiences and insights with players. The show airs at 7:30 pm ET on NBC and Peacock. This marks his first appearance on NBC in 25 years.

title: Who is Paul Ingrassia? Donald Trump's nominee withdraws over racist texts flap
content: President Trump's nominee for federal watchdog, Paul Ingrassia, withdrew his candidacy after "racist and pro-Nazi" texts were leaked. Ingrassia's comments, including disparaging remarks about Martin Luther King Jr. and Asian individuals, led to Republican senators withdrawing their support, forcing his withdrawal from the confirmation hearing.

title: No handshake with Pak! India captain declines pre-game gesture at Asian Youth Games
content: India's Kabaddi team dominated Pakistan 81-26 at the Asian Youth Games, continuing a trend of silent protest. Indian captain Ishant Rathee notably declined a pre-game handshake, mirroring similar gestures by Indian cricketers. This victory, following earlier wins, solidifies India's top standing in the debut Kabaddi event, with finals on October 23rd.

title: Priyanka Chopra, Nick Jonas host intimate Diwali celebration with family and friends
content: Priyanka Chopra celebrated Diwali with family and friends, including Nick Jonas and daughter Malti Marie, sharing heartwarming moments of rituals and festivities on Instagram. She expressed joy in introducing the festival's beauty to newcomers, highlighting the gathering of loved ones and the hope it signifies. Chopra also recommended her film 'Dil Dhadakne Do' for those new to Bollywood.

title: Stephen and Ayesha Curry divorce rumors spark after her recent remarks
content: Recent rumors of a Stephen and Ayesha Curry divorce were fueled by Ayesha's "Call Her Daddy" podcast comments about not wanting marriage or children. However, no evidence supports these claims, as their social media shows continued affection and family photos. Steph recently posted a tribute to Ayesha, calling her his 'rock'.

title: Punjab shocker: Ex-DGP, wife booked over son‚Äôs suspicious death; video sparks probe
content: Former Punjab DGP Mohammad Mustafa and his wife, ex-minister Razia Sultana, are among four booked by Haryana Police in connection with their son Akil Akhter's death. Akhter was found dead under suspicious circumstances, with social media posts alleging threats to his life. A Special Investigation Team has been formed to probe the matter.

title: Delhi breathes worst Diwali air in 4 years! Tuesday winds prevent ‚Äòsevere‚Äô drop
content: Delhi's air quality plunged into the 'very poor' category on Diwali night as firecracker violations surged, pushing PM2.5 levels to their highest since 2021. Despite a temporary spike, rising winds and warmer temperatures prevented a prolonged severe episode. Authorities are monitoring the situation, with Stage III of GRAP not yet invoked.

title: ‚ÄòTop guns‚Äô fall silent: Oppn battles internal conflicts; NDA launches poll campaign in Bihar
content: As Bihar's second phase nominations closed, the INDIA bloc faced internal conflicts with partners contesting at least 11 seats. Opposition leaders remained largely absent from the campaign trail, with social media accounts inactive, leaving candidates to campaign independently. Meanwhile, the NDA launched its campaign, highlighting government initiatives.

title: US Marshal and immigrant shot during ICE operation in South LA; probe under way
content: A federal operation in South Los Angeles turned violent Tuesday when a US Marshal and an undocumented immigrant, who had previously escaped custody, were shot. The suspect allegedly rammed federal vehicles in an attempt to flee, prompting law enforcement to fire defensive shots. Both individuals sustained non-life-threatening injuries and are hospitalized.

title: Pancreatic cancer: 4 warning signs in your legs that you shouldn't ignore
content: Pancreatic cancer, a deadly disease, may first signal its presence through leg symptoms like pain, swelling, redness, and warmth. These often overlooked signs, linked to blood clots or tumor compression, can precede typical indicators such as jaundice. Recognizing these early leg warnings is crucial for prompt diagnosis and potentially improving survival rates against this aggressive cancer.

title: Xi's purge: Bosses are disappearing in China - at alarming rate
content: Powerful figures in China are disappearing at an alarming rate. Top generals and CEOs are being detained or purged. This trend spans both the military and corporate elite. These crackdowns reflect a new phase in Xi Jinping's rule. Fear and obedience are being enforced across economic and military power centers. The scale of these purges is staggering.

title: After 50 years, NSCN-IM leader Muivah to visit birthplace in Manipur‚Äôs Somdal today
content: NSCN-IM leader Thuingaleng Muivah, 91, returns to his birthplace Somdal village in Manipur after over five decades. His visit, long awaited by the Tangkhul Naga community, is seen as significant amidst ongoing ethnic clashes. The homecoming is met with widespread excitement and support, with arrangements meticulously planned for his week-long stay.

title: Bihar polls: Fewer Yadav candidates fielded by NDA as it looks to consolidate core base
content: Bihar's ruling NDA shifts focus to consolidating its traditional vote base, significantly reducing Yadav candidates fielded by BJP and JD(U). This strategic pivot sees replacements from Kushwaha, Nishad, and Vaishya communities, signaling a move away from social engineering towards core voter mobilization.

title: Bad omen? Trump-Putin meet in Budapest on hold; Rubio calls Lavrov
content: A US official announced no immediate plans for a meeting between Presidents Trump and Putin, following a call between Secretary Rubio and Foreign Minister Lavrov. The Kremlin also confirmed no precise timeframe for a summit. This comes after Trump previously suggested a meeting in Budapest within two weeks.

title: Charges against Sonam Wangchuk ‚Äòflimsy, childish, baseless‚Äô: Wife
content: Wife of jailed climate activist Sonam Wangchuk submitted a representation calling charges against him "flimsy and baseless." She stated that videos cited by authorities were taken out of context and misinterpreted, arguing his arrest aims to silence peaceful advocacy for Ladakh's statehood and democratic rights.

title: Naqvi to India: 'Bring your captain and receive Asia Cup trophy from me'
content: The ACC chairman has proposed a Dubai ceremony on November 10 for India to receive the Asia Cup trophy, following the team's refusal to accept it from him after their win. This comes after a series of exchanges between the ACC and BCCI, with India having a perfect record against Pakistan in the tournament.

content: When not covering crime, he reads fiction, roams around the dark alleys of the city in the dead of night.
